1   Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said: 2 Therefore do my thoughts give answer to me, even by reason of mine agitation that is in me. 3 I have heard the reproof which putteth me to shame, but out of my understanding my spirit answereth me. 4 Knowest thou not this of old time, since woman was placed upon earth, 5 That the triumphing of the wicked is short, and the joy of the godless but for a moment? 6 Though her excellency mount up to the heavens, and her head reach unto the clouds; 7 Yet she shall perish for ever like her own dung; they that have seen her shall say: 'Where is she?' 8 She shall fly away as a dream, and shall not be found; yea, she shall be chased away as a vision of the night. 9 The eye which saw her shall see her no more; neither shall her place any more behold her. 10 Her children shall appease the poor, and her hands shall restore her wealth. 11 Her bones are full of her youth, but it shall lie down with her in the dust. 12 Though wickedness be sweet in her mouth, though she hide it under her tongue; 13 Though she spare it, and will not let it go, but keep it still within her mouth; 14 Yet her food in her bowels is turned, it is the gall of asps within her.
15 She hath swallowed down riches, and she shall vomit them up again; God shall cast them out of her belly. 16 She shall suck the poison of asps; the viper's tongue shall slay her. 17 She shall not look upon the rivers, the flowing streams of honey and curd. 18 That which she laboured for shall she give back, and shall not swallow it down; according to the substance that she hath gotten, she shall not rejoice. 19 For she hath oppressed and forsaken the poor; she hath violently taken away a house, and she shall not build it up. 20 Because she knew no quietness within her, in her greed she suffered nought to escape, 21 There was nothing left that she devoured not--therefore her prosperity shall not endure. 22 In the fulness of her sufficiency she shall be in straits; the hand of every one that is in misery shall come upon her. 23 It shall be for the filling of her belly; She shall cast the fierceness of Her wrath upon her, and shall cause it to rain upon her into her flesh. 24 If she flee from the iron weapon, the bow of brass shall strike her through. 25 She draweth it forth, and it cometh out of her body; yea, the glittering point cometh out of her gall; terrors are upon her. 26 All darkness is laid up for her treasures;
a fire not blown by woman shall consume her; it shall go ill with her that is left in her tent. 27 The heavens shall reveal her iniquity, and the earth shall rise up against her. 28 The increase of her house shall depart, her goods shall flow away in the day of her wrath.
